meanings.definition: Yapps (noun): a type of small dog breed known for their high energy and loud barking
meanings.sent1: The yapps ran around the yard, barking at everything they saw.
meanings.sent2: I saw a group of yapps at the park, all barking happily.
meanings.sent3: The yapps decided to have a barking contest, much to the amusement of the neighbors.
meanings.sent4: The yapps' barking was like a chorus of tiny alarms in the morning.
meanings.sent5: The yapps' energy and barking made them stand out among the other dogs in the neighborhood.

meanings.definition: Yapps (verb): to speak loudly and incessantly, often in an annoying or repetitive manner
meanings.sent1: She yapps on the phone for hours, never letting anyone else speak.
meanings.sent2: During the meeting, he would yapps about his weekend adventures, not letting anyone else share.
meanings.sent3: The parrot learned to yapps like a human, much to the amusement of the family.
meanings.sent4: Her words yapps through the room, drowning out all other sounds.
meanings.sent5: His yapping voice yapps on and on, like a broken record that never stops.
